triples.name: K-means clustering
triples.relevance: The paper builds on k-means as the foundational clustering algorithm that is extended with the novel unsupervised approach.

triples.name: Cluster analysis
triples.relevance: Clustering is the primary task addressed in the paper, partitioning data into groups of similar objects.

triples.name: Unsupervised learning
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a true unsupervised learning schema for k-means that operates without labeled data or initialization requirements.

triples.name: Pattern recognition
triples.relevance: The paper mentions pattern recognition as a key application domain for clustering algorithms.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: The paper addresses a fundamental machine learning problem of unsupervised clustering without initialization parameters.

triples.name: Determining the number of clusters in a data set
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel method to automatically determine the optimal number of clusters without prior knowledge or parameter selection.
